org.block.project.block.java.value

Class AbstractValue<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.block.project.block.AbstractBlock
      • org.block.project.block.java.value.AbstractValue<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The expected output type of the value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Block, Block.TextBlock, Block.ValueBlock<V>, Block.ValueBlock.ConnectedValueBlock<V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanBlock, NumberBlock, StringBlock

    public abstract class AbstractValue<V>
extends AbstractBlock
implements Block.ValueBlock.ConnectedValueBlock<V>, Block.TextBlock
    AbstractValue is a block that has a dedicated value provided with it. No other blocks can directly affect this block in terms of it being attached to another block.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text of the block. This should display the value that is attached. Note that setting the value using setValue(Object) will override the set text, therefore this function should be ran after the setting of the value if you wish to use abnormal text
        Specified by:
        setText in interface Block.TextBlock
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display

      • getText
